titles.title: United States Library Trust Fund Act
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for designation of overpayments and contributions to the United States Library Trust Fund, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Education and the Workforce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to House Ways and Means

term.name: Federal aid to the arts and humanities

bill.summary: 1/4/2005--Introduced. United States Library Trust Fund Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to: (1) establish in the Treasury the United States Library Trust Fund (Fund); and (2) permit a taxpayer to designate one dollar of any tax overpayment and any cash contribution which the taxpayer includes with a return to the Fund. Provides for grants from the Fund to public libraries and public school libraries.
